title: "Hay Baling 101: Essential Tips for Cutting and Storing Hay"

tasks.task: Familiarize oneself with hay baler types and the baling process.
subtasks: Explain the difference between round and square balers.
Describe the procedure for cutting hay and allowing it to dry in the field.
Detail the steps involved in organizing windrows of hay.
Operate a tractor and baler to pick up hay and compress it into bales.
Adjust baler settings to ensure proper bale size and tightness.
Tie bales using appropriate materials and techniques.
Release bales from the baler onto the field.
Determine the appropriate storage location based on bale type.
Arrange round bales on a well-drained surface and in protective rows.
Stack square bales on pallets and consider indoor storage if possible.
Ensure proper ventilation for all stored bales.
Cover outdoor stored bales with tarps elevated off the ground.
Identify causes and solutions for uneven bales.
Adjust settings to prevent bales that are too loose or too tight.
Diagnose and fix twine or net wrap failures.
Monitor moisture content in hay to prevent mold and combustion.
Clean the baler after each use.
Lubricate moving parts as per manufacturer's guidelines.
Regularly check and tighten bolts and chains.
Inspect and replace belts if necessary.
Conduct a thorough pre-season inspection on the baler.
